jobs.description: Industry X.0 is the digital innovation unit of the largest management consulting company in the world.
jobs.summary: Direct hire position within Pillar Technology (now Industry X.0), responsible for an Agile transformation and delivery team at a Fortune 10 company.
responsibilities: Responsible for the welfare of my development team at the client site
Guiding the client in creating a feasible roadmap and adopting an Agile mindset
Ensuring the client is happy with the services rendered by the development team
Aligning goals of the client, team, and end-users to ensure successful delivery
Understanding the problem the client is facing and solutioning to resolve it
Growing the development team with client people to facilitate a graceful exit from the engagement
Uplifting client team members to Accenture's delivery standards
Coaching team members in Agile delivery practices
Acting as the IT counterpart of the Product Owner, bridging the gap between Business and IT
Performing semi-annual performance reviews to ensure team members are progressing on their growth path
Responsible for project financials and approving expenses
achievements: Shifted client's mindset to focus on value-driven delivery (vs. management dictated delivery)
Delivered the minimum viable product (MVP) for the client's Billing Platform that will be used enterprise-wide
Created metrics that are used by management to understand the pace of delivery consistently across teams
Aligned client's space with the upcoming mandate to move to a product driven organization model
Helped the client make architectural decisions that aligned the direction of their product with their vision
Made the client see Accenture as a partner rather than a staff augmentor and became a trusted advisor in the process
Colocated business and IT to eliminate communication barriers and increase velocity
Had 3 scope of work/contract renewals approved by client over the course of 12 months
Managed a budget of over $2m and ensured scope of work was signed off on completion
Influenced the long-term strategic plan of a business unit of a Fortune 10 corporation

jobs.description: Vectorform is a state of the art digital agency, innovation driver, and think tank that caters to clients and end users worldwide.
jobs.summary: Direct hire position within the Project Management Organization at Vectorform in the capacity of product manager and technical project manager in charge of delivering the Mopar.com program.
achievements: Reduced a 1.5 year delivery lag to 0
Launched Mopar.com to consumers on 9/23/16
Aligned the vision of the client to a feasible roadmap that produced the most value to consumers
Managed the program's budget of $10m to ensure adequate staffing across functional teams
Achieved set financial targets for the Mopar.com product
Responsible for overseeing production of the product on 3 platforms (Web, Android, iOS)
Managed both off-shore and on-shore development teams to create the Mopar.com backend
Started the first in-house enterprise-level JAVA development team at Vectorform
Increased efficiency across all Vectorform project teams by creating project management standards
Defined the Product Manager role at Vectorform
Defined the Mopar.com Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)
Implemented and optimized standard agile ceremonies in the SDLC
Promoted engineering best practices and added accountability to team-members through the use of peer reviews, transitioning team from SVN to GIT, code standards to achieve JAVA best practices, etc.
Actively participated in all major deployments of the application and provided insight and input to successfully promote to production
Established requirement collection and writing standards
Raised awareness of business analysis and quality assurance gaps and helped human resources fill them

jobs.description: GSTV holds market dominance as the largest network in North America to advertise and display content at the pump.
jobs.summary: Consulting position facilitating the project management and business analysis for an in-house built Enterprise Resource Planning system.
achievements: Improved the accuracy of inventory reports for the executive team by 60% - this increased their understanding of when GSTV is oversold or undersold as a network
Defined the company's Scrum Agile Software Development Life cycle (SDLC)
Introduced checks and balances in SDLC that led to a significant increase in the team’s performance
Implemented JIRA and Confluence and designed workflows to integrate these tools in the SDLC
Estimated, planned, and tracked time, scope, and cost for Gbase – a custom ERP built in-house that will be used by all the departments of the company
Gathered requirements from internal and external stakeholders while interacting with all levels of management
Developed full stack technical specifications for the development of Gbase
Architected an extensible data model based on Gbase’s data requirements
Architected interim applications used to automate functions of Gbase and transition several departments to Gbase
Developed processes and scripts to facilitate Extracting, Transforming, and Loading (ETL) data from legacy data sources into the Gbase database
Maintained legacy applications and databases that were critical to the company
Managed relationships with off-site development team members
Trained QA personnel and supervised the creation of test cases and test plans for all internal projects
Actively participated in UX/UI improvement and design discussions
Performed UAT validation testing with business stakeholders

jobs.description: MOTOR is the largest provider of aftermarket automotive information in the world; it is a big data company with hundreds of databases and monthly transactional throughput exceeding 30petabytes.
jobs.summary: Consulting position for facilitating requirements and overcoming the technical challenges of an application with data sources that have in the range of 10-100 million records.
achievements: Improved the role of Business Analysts in the company and defined the SDLC process for both Agile and Waterfall projects
Introduced the usage of Sharepoint for document management within the Selectline Estimating Application (for BA and QA)
Crafted BA Approach Documents for both Agile and Waterfall projects revolving around ETL-ing data
Streamlined communication between Application Development stakeholders
Gathered, clarified, and approved requirements with product managers weekly
Translated requirements into detailed technical specifications
Helped the UX/UI and WebServices team get a thorough comprehension of the data and its structure
Trained users in the usage of Microsoft Test Manager (MSTM) to streamline QA
Created and executed formal test plans using MSTM
Organized Product Acceptance Testing (PAT) and User Acceptance Testing (UAT) with tailored test plans and coordinated their execution with the stakeholders
Trained stakeholders in the usage of Team Foundation Server
Created various advanced queries, stored procedures, and table valued functions in SQL Server 2012 to help data team and retrieve samples for development team

jobs.description: ATEX is a residential appraising company that services the Metro Detroit Area. In 2013 it had appraised properties with an aggregate value of over $500 million. ATEX provides business process automation solutions to other appraisers.
jobs.summary: Longterm engagement where I accumulated experience in the entire product life cycle by creating products that help internal and external end-users in the fulfillment of the residential appraising process.
achievements: Managed Information Systems and achieved 99% uptime during core hours
Innovated USPAP-compliant proprietary approach to appraisal writing process which improved turnaround time by 65% and gave the company a competitive advantage in its market
Expanded company horizons to new markets shifting focus from residential appraising to servicing the industry with new solutions developed internally
Determined goals and requirements for various IT projects
Acted as cross-functional liaison establishing proper communication channels between PM, development team, QA and other stakeholders
Conducted product feasibility, market and profitability studies
Implemented SDLC and DSDM agile methodologies in company’s project management framework
Coordinated with QA for thorough end-to-end testing of developed .NET 4.0 applications and interactions with SQL databases
Constructed complex SQL queries to help development team with reporting
Built stored procedures and functions in SQL to help development team optimize database transactions
Provided hands-on support of application front-end development in HTML5, Javascript

jobs.description: Enertia is a web design company with clients all over the nation; its solutions span from simple websites to full-fledged web-based applications.
jobs.summary: Summer contract position that involved LAMP stack development.
achievements: Developed web applications from start to finish
Communicated with stakeholders to identify project requirements
Managed relationship between Enertia and clients during and post development
Provided customer support to clients on previously developed projects
